content.description:
A very fun and challenging route.  Climb up to the roof, use hand jams to pull over the roof.  Continue to the top of the crack using fists, and offwidth technique or any face features that can be found.  I'd recommend taping as the rock can be kind of sharp. 

 RCM&W #45, p.43.
content.protection: Large hexes and cams from #1-#4 or #5 (camalot), preferably with doubles of #4.
content.location: This route follows the prominent crack on the right end of this buttress.

content.description: Slightly overhanging flakes and jugs, Left of Oath
climb face to ledge, up crack/dihedral/chimney.
content.protection: TR, or standard rack to lead.
content.location: Left side of large ledge, left of Oath of Fealty and Destination Unknown

content.description: Climb straight up the right side of the shallow pillar.  Pull on rocks that look loose to get up on to the Buffalo's Buldge. Pull on flakes and pockets to the top. Don't stray over to the left or right climbs...aka...the climb is a little contrived, butt fun.
content.protection: standard anchor - can use the same one from Destination
content.location: Look for the buldge/face between Oath and Destination.

content.description: Gain a ledge about eight or ten feet up.  A left facing dihedral with an obvious handcrack leads up from there.  Negotiate straight over a small bulge and youre done.
content.protection: hand sized pieces and a bit larger might do. (bd 1-3 or similar hexes, though a # 2 and 2 hexes were what I used)   gear anchor
content.location: To the left and around the courner from Celtis Crack. Left facing dihedral.

climbs.name: Buffalo Burr
climbs.fa: Sam Smolnisky and Nora Olson Maybe?

content.description: Start in the chimney left of Destination Unknown.  Gain a ledge and work your way up the dihedral using the crack.  Crack is short but sweet.
content.location: Located about 10ft left of Desination Unknown.

content.description: The furtherest north climbable cliff in the shade before reaching Prairie Walls Area.  This buttress contains three routes the best of which is probably Oath of Fealty (5.10b).  These climbs are well covered by foliage and are therefore in the shade pretty much all day.  The down side is depending on the time of year it may be buggier than other areas.
